DataElement.preferredName: Patient Oral Medication Administration Fasting Ability Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._As pertains to a medication: ingest, inhale, instill, or inject._A drug or medicine that treats or prevents or alleviates the symptoms of disease._A systemic evaluation of the body and it's functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment._Abstaining from food._Oral; of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth._A drug or medicine that treats or prevents or alleviates the symptoms of disease._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._Abstaining from food._The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment ._the yes/no indicator related to the evaluation of the patient and patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Oral Medication Administration Fasting Ability
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._As pertains to a medication: ingest, inhale, instill, or inject._A drug or medicine that treats or prevents or alleviates the symptoms of disease._A systemic evaluation of the body and it's functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment._Abstaining from food._Oral; of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth._A drug or medicine that treats or prevents or alleviates the symptoms of disease._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._Abstaining from food._The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment .

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Oral; of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.:A drug or medicine that treats or prevents or alleviates the symptoms of disease.                           :The act of administration.:Abstaining from food.:The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment .

Concepts.definition: Of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.
The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the patient able to take o
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient able to take oral medication and maintain a fast for 2 hours before and 1 hour after MLN8237 administration?
